meanings.definition: Glamour: an attractive or exciting quality that makes certain people or things seem appealing
meanings.sent1: The movie star possessed a natural glammer that captivated everyone around her.
meanings.sent2: The glammer of the city lights at night was truly mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The magician added a touch of glammer to his performance by using sparkly props.
meanings.sent4: The glammer of the diamond necklace outshone all the other jewelry in the store.
meanings.sent5: The glammer of the sunset painted the sky in vibrant hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: Glamorous: having an attractive or exciting quality that makes someone or something seem appealing
meanings.sent1: She felt glamorous in her sparkly dress and high heels.
meanings.sent2: The glamorous movie star walked down the red carpet with confidence.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked surprisingly glamorous wearing a tiny bow tie.
meanings.sent4: The glamorous mansion on the hill stood out among the other houses.
meanings.sent5: The glamorous party was filled with laughter and music.

meanings.definition: Glamorize: to make something or someone seem more attractive or exciting than they really are
meanings.sent1: The magazine cover was heavily glamorized with airbrushed models.
meanings.sent2: She tried to glamorize her resume by adding exaggerated achievements.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to glamorize the dessert by adding edible gold leaf.
meanings.sent4: The marketing team worked hard to glamorize the new product launch.
meanings.sent5: The artist used bright colors to glamorize the plain white canvas.
